text: New Albany and Salem Railroad Station, also known as the Louisville and Nashville (Monon) Railroad Station, was a historic train station located at Gosport, Owen County, Indiana. It was built between 1854 and 1858 by the New Albany and Salem Railroad. It was a one-story, simple brick structure measuring 58 feet wide by 123 feet long. Note: This includes It has been demolished. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1976 and delisted in 1983. ==References== Category:Former National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Railway stations on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Railway stations in the United States opened in 1858 Gosport Category:National Register of Historic Places in Owen County, Indiana Category:Transportation buildings and structures in Owen County, Indiana
title: New Albany and Salem Railroad Station (Gosport, Indiana)
